channel.title: Comments on: More of the Rossmere

item.title: By: nathan
item.dc:creator: nathan
item.content:encoded:
An image of the Rossmere in its final days, from the Cushman Collection.

Note the background:

Which bears some resemblance (as shot from the deck of the DWP) to this:

Heck, let’s run with the then-and-now. The Rossmere, sitting on its corner of Hope and First, Hope St. obscured by a mound of dirt:

And that corner today.

item.title: By: nathan
item.dc:creator: nathan
item.content:encoded:

Another glimpse from our visit to the model, peering south down Hope across the intersection of First.

item.title: By: nathan
item.dc:creator: nathan
item.content:encoded:
Looking east on First, from Flower toward Hope, 1926:

Rossmere at Hope and First; further in we’ve the 1902 Warner Apts at 710 and the 1911 Maxine (at far right, with the tall columns), 724 W First.

Courtesy USC Digital Archives
